08051-d-11-12-08-TRRA.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATE 1850, UP MCHTR WAS INSTRUCTED TO SHOVE INTO TRACK 3 FROM THE SOUTH END.  UP MCHTR TRAIN CONSISTED OF 123 CARS, 7929 FEET, AND 9436 TONS.  TRRA UTILITY MAN WAS PROTECTING SHOVES AND ATTACHED TO THE TRAIN.  HE BEGAN BY GIVING THE ENGINEER "CLEAR FOR 35 CARS".  HE THEN COUNTED HIM FROM 25, 15, 10, 5, 4, 3, AND 2 CAR LENGTHS WITH THE ENGINEER ACKNOWLEDGING AT EACH REDUCED CAR COUNT.  ATTWO CAR LENGTHS, IT BECAME EVIDENT THAT THE TRAIN WAS NOT GOING TO STOP.  THE UTILITY MAN TOLD THEMCHTR THAT WILL DO.  BUT, THE MCHTR TRAIN SHOVED THROUGH THE NORTH END SWITCH OF MADISON THREE AND INTO THE SIDE OF THE TRRA 231 WHICH WAS PULLING 43 CARS NORTH OUT OF TRACK 2.  THE RESULT WAS A SIDECOLLISION AND 5 CARS DERAILED.  MCHTR ENGINEER FAILED TO TAKE APPROPRIATE MEASURES TO STOP THE TRAIN.

0811201-d-11-20-08-MMA.Narrative: TRAIN NO. 530 WAS PROCEEDING NORTH AT GRAND ISLE, MAINE, MILE 8.66 WITH 14-2 1488 WHEN TRAIN UNEXPECTEDLY ENTERED THE SOUTH SIDING AND STRUCK ONE PARTIALLY LOADED CAR OF LOGS AND TWO EMPTY RACK CARS.THE FOLLOWING INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THE SOUTH SWITCH HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY STRUCK AND DISLODGEDBY A TRUCK SOMETIME PRIOR TO ARRIVAL OF THE TRAIN.  THE PRIOR DAMAGE TO THE SWITCH WAS SUCH THAT THE TARGET WAS NOT CHANGED BUT THE SWITCH POINTS WERE OPENED UP ENOUGH TO CAUSE THE TRAIN TO ENTER THESIDING.  IMPACT WAS ESTIMATED AT 15 MPH.  AS SOON AS THE CREW REALIZED THEY WERE ENTERING THE SIDING THE ENGINEER PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.  NO CARS IN THE TRAIN WERE DERAILED. EQUIPMENT IN THE SIDING DERAILED AS FOLLOWS: BAR 11019 EMPTY B END DERAILED, BAR 12023 EMPTY BOTH ENDS DERAILED, BAR 12021 PARTIAL LOAD OF LOGS NOT DERAILED BUT RECEIVED COUPLER DAMAGE.  CREW NOT INJURIED.  MAINE STATE POLICE INVESTIGATING.  CROR OCS RULE IN EFFECT.

OP11178-d-11-17-08-WTJR.Reporting Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP11178-d-11-17-08-WTJR.Maintenance Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP11178-d-11-17-08-WTJR.Narrative: THE LBJ63 16, UPRR LOCAL, ARRIVED AT WICHITA FALLS WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 40 CARS AROUND 1:00 A.M. ON NOVEMBER 17, 2008.  THEY PULLED THEIR TRAIN INTO YARD TRACK NUMBER 1, CUT OFF 36 CARS, LEAVING 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 4 LOADED CARS.  THE ENGINEER PULLED AHEAD TO SET THE REMAINING CARS INTO YARD TRACK #3 AT WHICH TIME HE RAN THROUGH THE YARD SWITCH (HE FAILED TO ENSURE ROUTE WAS PROPERLY LINED BEFOREMOVEMENT - RULE 8.2).  HE PULLED THE 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 1.5 CARS THROUGH THIS SWITCH.  WHEN HE MADE HIS REVERSE MOVE, THE WEST TRUCK OF THE ADMX 52604 AND THE EAST TRUCK OF GPLX 75941 DERAILED AT THE BRIDGE SWITCH.  THE WEST TRUCK OF THE GPLX 75941 AND THE TWO LOCOMOTIVES FOLLWED THE SWITCH DOWN THEOPPOSITE SIDE OF THE YARD.  THE ADMX AND THE GPLX TRAVELED OVER 350 FEED FROM THEIR POINT OF DERAILING.  BY THIS TIME, THE GPLX WAS ALMOST PERPENDICULAR TO TRACKS #3 AND 4 AND THE DAMAGE CAUSED TO YARD SWITCH LEADING TO TRACK #`S 4 AND 5 CAUSED THE UP 1990 TO DERAIL.  (THE TRAIN CREW REVERSED MOVEMENT OVER A SWITCH THAT HAD BEEN RUN THROUGH.  RULE 8.15)  THUS CAUSING THE DERAILMENT.

111508-d-11-15-08-WTLC.Narrative: AS THE ENGINEER WAS PULLING HIS TRAIN TO LUBBOCK HE WENT ACROSS A BAD SPOT IN THE RAIL AT M.P. 32.5.  AS HIS LEAD UNIT WENT OVERTHE SPOT IT FELT ABOUT LIKE IT USUALLY DID AT THIS SPOT; LEANING TO THERIGHT WHEN EASTBOUNT. HE LOWERED HIS THROTTLE POSITION FROM NOTCH TWO TO IDLE SO HE WOULD SLOW DOWNOR OR TWO MPH. HE SLOWED FROM 10MPH TO ABOUT 9PMH. HE THEN FELT A HARD JERK FROM THE TRAIN. HE REACHED TO PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AND BY THE TIME HE DID THE AIR BLEW OUT ON ITS OWN. AT THAT TIMEHE NOTIFIED HIS GENERAL SUPERINTENDENT  OF THE DERAILMENT.

614500-d-11-17-08-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)

614500-d-11-17-08-IC.Narrative: R92571-13 WAS SWITCHING IN THE NEW YARD AT PRESIDENTS ISLAND.  THEY WERE SHOVING INTO TRACK 7 WHEN SSAM 40004 ROLLED OUT OF TRACK #2 AND INTO THE CARS THEY WERE SWITCHING.  SSAM 40004 DERAILED AND DAMAGED CARS CRGX 19055, PRGX 10799, PRGX 10638, CRGX 6160, SOU 88920, NS 252198, ITC 5756, CRGX 19026,CRGX 5756.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CREW FAILED TO MAKE SURE THAT SSAM 40004HAD COUPLED AFTER KICKING IT INTO THE TRACK.  WHILE PROTECTING THE SHOVE IN TRACK #7,  THE CONDUCTOR WAS INFORMED BY THE TRAINEE THAT SOMETHING WAS WRONG AND HE SHOULD COME BACK AND CHECK IT OUT.  UPON INSPECTION.  THEY FOUND THAT SSAM 40004 HAD ROLLED BACK INTO THEIR CUT CAUSING THE RAKING OF 9 CARS AND DERAILING ONE SET OF TRUCKS ON SAMX 40004.

614719-d-11-20-08-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
614719-d-11-20-08-IC.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
614719-d-11-20-08-IC.Narrative: L50071-20 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF DELIVERING 67 CARS TO PRESIDENT'S ISLAND WHEN THEY DERAILED 11 CARSON THE REAR OF THEIR TRAIN.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT FOUND THAT EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCE CAUSED CGCX 20239 TO CLIMB THE RAIL.  TAPES WERE DOWNLOADED AND COMPARED TO THE ENGINEER'S STATEMENT.  WHICH VALIDATED THE CAUSE TO BE IMPROPER TRAIN HANDLING.  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  IT WAS FOUND THAT THE DERAILMENT STARTED ON THE IC'S TRACK AND WAS DRAGGED ONTO THE BNSF'S TRACK.  THE BNSF REPORTED $164,119 IN TRACK DAMAGE AND REPORT NUMBER SF-1108-132.  RAILROAD VERIFIEDTHE TRACK CLASS AND CONSIST SPEED.  THE ENGINEER WAS GOING DOWN A HILL, PICKED UP SPEED TOO FAST, THEN PANICKED AND GRABBED TOO MUCH AIR AND DYNAMIC TO BRAKE THE TRAIN CAUSING THE EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCEAND DERAILMENT.

SW1108100-d-11-09-08-BNSF.Narrative: Z-NBYWSP1-08 WAS SETTING OUT UPS PIGS TO 7203 TRACK AND PUT TWO CARS ON THE GROUND.  THE CONDUCTOR SET OUT THE ABQ CAR AND PULLED 3 TO 4 EAST AND RELINED THE DERAIL.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN INSTRUCTED THEENGINEER TO GO WEST 12 CARS.  WHEN HE STARTED MOVEMENT, HE REALIZED HE GAVE THE WRONG DIRECTION & CALLED TO STOP MOVEMENT AND RAN OVER DERAIL & IMPACTING THE TTAX553072 CAUSING BOTH CARS TO DERAIL.CONTAINED ARTICULATED EQUIPMENT. NO HAZ-MAT RELEASE.
